title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 52-4.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 52-4.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

For the purposes of this Subpart, unless the context indicates otherwise, the following terms shall have the following meanings: (a) Cardiovascular tissue donor means a human being, living or dead, who is the source of cardiovascular tissue for transplantation, including autogeneic tissue. (b) Critical work area means an area where sterile tissue containers or aseptically retrieved tissue are exposed to the environment. (c) Critical surface means a surface which comes into contact with aseptically retrieved tissue, sterile tissue containers or sterile container covers. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
52-4.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
